The content world in which to install the message handler. Use the content world to scope your message handler to specific parts of your JavaScript code.
The name of the message handler. This parameter must be unique within the user content controller and must not be an empty string.
The user content controller uses this parameter to define a JavaScript function for your message handler in all frames in the specified content world. The name of this function is
corresponds to the value of this parameter.  For example, if you specify the string

To execute your handlerâ€™s code, call the JavaScript function that this method defines. You may pass a parameter value to the method. The user content controller packages that value into an appropriate type and delivers it to your content handlerâ€™s delegate method.

abstract.text: Integrate web content seamlessly into your app, and customize content interactions to meet your appâ€™s needs.
An object that defines a scope of execution for JavaScript code, and which you use to prevent conflicts between different scripts.
An interface for receiving messages from JavaScript code running in a webpage.
An interface for responding to messages from JavaScript code running in a webpage.
An object for managing interactions between JavaScript code and your web view, and for filtering content in your web view.
Installs a message handler that you can call from the specified content world in your JavaScript code.
Installs a message handler that you can call from your JavaScript code.
Installs a message handler that returns a reply to your JavaScript code.
Uninstalls all custom message handlers associated with the user content controller.
Uninstalls all custom message handlers from the specified content world in your JavaScript code.
Uninstalls the custom message handler with the specified name from your JavaScript code.
Uninstalls a custom message handler from the specified content world in your JavaScript code.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
